cellularAutomata.lattice
Class MooreRadiusOneDimLattice

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<Cell>
              cellularAutomata.lattice.OneDimensionalLattice
                  cellularAutomata.lattice.MooreRadiusOneDimLattice
All Implemented Interfaces:
Lattice, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Cell>, java.util.Collection<Cell>, java.util.List<Cell>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class MooreRadiusOneDimLattice
extends OneDimensionalLattice

A one-dimensional square lattice with wrap around boundary conditions and a Moore neighborhood of radius r. Radius 1 corresponds to a nearest-neighbor "one-dim (2 neighbor)". The number of neighbors (excluding the central cell) is 2r. The wrap around conditions and neighbors are implemented in the getNeighbors() method.

By convention, the neighbors start at the far left and move to the right.

Author:
David Bahr
See Also:

Field Detail

DISPLAY_NAME

public static final java.lang.String DISPLAY_NAME
The display name for this lattice.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

radius

public static int radius
The radius of the neighborhood (radius = 1 corresponds to the nearest-neighbor lattice). This value may be reset by the PropertyPanel.

Constructor Detail

MooreRadiusOneDimLattice

public MooreRadiusOneDimLattice()
Default constructor required of all Lattices (for reflection). Typically not used to build the lattice, but instead used to gain access to methods such as getDisplayName() and getNumberOfNeighbors().

MooreRadiusOneDimLattice

public MooreRadiusOneDimLattice(java.lang.String initialStateFilePath,
                                Rule rule,
                                int maxHistory)
Create a one-dimensional cellular automaton with the same rule at all positions. The height and width of the automaton and the initial state of each cell is specified in a file.

Parameters:
rule - The rule applied to all cells.
initialStateFilePath - The path to the file that specifies the initial state of the cellular automaton. If null, uses default initial state.
maxHistory - The maximum number of generations (or time steps) that will be remembered by the Cells on the lattice.
Method Detail

getDisplayName

public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
A brief one or two-word string describing the rule, appropriate for display in a drop-down list.

Returns:
A string no longer than 25 characters.

getNumberOfNeighbors

public int getNumberOfNeighbors()
Returns the number of neighbors of a cell on the lattice (excluding the cell). If the cell's have a varying number of neighbors, then this returns -1, and the user should use getNeighbors(Cell cell) to find the number of neighbors for any particular cell.

Returns:
The number of neighbors for each cell, or -1 if that number is variable.

getToolTipDescription

public java.lang.String getToolTipDescription()
A tooltip that describes the lattice.

Returns:
The tooltip.

getView

public LatticeView getView()
Gets the graphics that tells the lattice how to display itself.

Returns:
The graphics view that tells this Lattice how to display.

setView

public void setView(LatticeView view)
Sets the graphics that tells the Lattice how to display itself. Unless a non-default is desired, the view does not have to be set by the user (because a default is always used).

Parameters:
view - The graphics view that tells this Lattice how to display.
